title: Are there many K-pop fans in the South (of the US)? If so, what are your peers reactions to you being a fan? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes there are a lot - that’s why so many KPop concerts happen in Atlanta! Thank the universe!!!! I have a group of friends who haven’t seen our teen years in decades - we’ve got grown children, are even grandmothers LOL My friends (& my family) are tolerant. They’ve seen me with weird tastes all my life. I’m a witch, a beledi dancer, an anime & SF fan, love fantasy (Tolkien), a member(former) of the SCA, a costumer (yep, predating this new-fangled cosplay thing), loved the Beatles in my teens, loved Zeppelin in my 20s (oh still DO love both groups) - etc etc etc I’m also a collector of BJDs… So me loving Korean dramas and music is just one more thing LOL

Yes. Mostly teens and not so much with my age bracket. My close friends and I share the same love for K-drama. So when this K-pop phenomenon blew up, it was just a matter of time that more and more people will be curious. When my non-kpop friends found out, they thought I was cute and were amused of me singing to Korean songs.
